Column 1 {data-width=200}
--------------------------------------------


### Positive

```{r}
us.data <- read.csv("https://covidtracking.com/api/v1/us/current.csv")

valueBox(
  value = us.data$positive,
  color = "warning",
  caption = paste("people have been infected by Sars-Cov-2 in the USA")
)
```

### Recovered

```{r}
valueBox(
  value = us.data$recovered,
  color = "success",
  caption = paste("people recovered of COVID-19 in the USA")
)
```


### Metric 2

```{r}
valueBox(
  value = us.data$death,
  color = "danger",
  caption = paste("people died of COVID-19 in the USA")
)
```

Column 2 {.tabset}
--------------------------------------------

### EVOLUTION OVER TIME

This tab contains time series: prevalence in the 100 most affected counties. You can select subsets.

```{r}
nyt.data <- read.csv(
  "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nytimes/covid-19-data/master/us-counties.csv",
  stringsAsFactors = FALSE
)
nyt.data$fips <- formatC(nyt.data$fips, width = 5, format = "d", flag = "0")

last.day <- (nyt.data[nyt.data$date == max(as.Date(nyt.data$date)), ])
last.day <- last.day[order(last.day$cases, decreasing = TRUE), ]
fips.20 <- last.day$fips[2:21]
fips.100 <- last.day$fips[2:50]

library(crosstalk)
library(plotly)
sd <- SharedData$new(nyt.data[nyt.data$fips %in% fips.100,], key = ~county)
fig <- plot_ly(sd, x = ~date) 
fig <- fig %>% add_trace(
  y = ~cases,
  color = ~fips,
  name= ~county,
  type = 'scatter',
  mode = 'lines+markers',
  marker = list(size = 2.5),
  line = list(width = 2))  

bscols(
  list(
    # filter_slider("mag", "Filter cases", sd, column = ~cases, step=2500, width=250),
    filter_select("stt", "Select state name:", sd, ~state),
    filter_select("ctw", "Select county name:", sd, ~county),
    filter_select("fps", "Select county FIPS:", sd, ~fips)
  ),
 fig,
  widths = c(3, NA)
)
```


### MAP OF INFECTION RATES

Below is a map reprensenting the number of cases per 100,000 individuals in each US county.

```{r, fig.height=5}
popup_dat <- paste0("<strong>County: </strong>", 
                    leafmap$NAME, 
                    "<br><strong>Cases: </strong>", 
                    round(leafmap$cases),
                    "<br><strong>Cases /100k: </strong>", 
                    round(leafmap$cases100k),
                    "<br><strong>Deaths: </strong>", 
                    round(leafmap$deaths),
                    "<br><strong>Deaths /100k: </strong>", 
                    round(leafmap$deaths100k))
pal <- colorQuantile("YlOrRd", leafmap$cases100k, n = 10, na.color = "#fff8e8")

### Render map in leaflet
leaflet(data = leafmap) %>% addTiles() %>%
  addPolygons(fillColor = ~pal(cases100k), 
              fillOpacity = 0.8, 
              color = "#BDBDC3", 
              weight = 1,
              popup = popup_dat)
```

### MAP OF TOTAL CASES

Below is a map reprensenting the total number of cases in each US county.


```{r}
### Render map in leaflet
leaflet(data = leafmap) %>% addTiles() %>%
  addPolygons(fillColor = ~pal(cases), 
              fillOpacity = 0.8, 
              color = "#BDBDC3", 
              weight = 1,
              popup = popup_dat)
```
